image.altText: Nigel Farage sits in a brown armchair, pointing at a photo of Vladimir Putin.

props.synopsis: Ahead of a historic UK election, five Facebook pages secretly operating from Nigeria are using Kremlin-aligned propaganda and AI-generated racist imagery to sow "division and chaos".

title.children: UK Conservatives say ABC analysis that points to foreign interference operation 'highly alarming'

image.altText: An oil painting of three Tahitians, one in the centre with their back turned and one on either side looking forwards.

props.synopsis: Celebrated 19th-century Post-Impressionist French painter and sculptor Paul Gauguin is one of the world's most famous artists, but his works have been cast in a new light ever since troubling allegations of sex crimes emerged.

title.children: Exhibition of works from celebrated, if controversial, artist opens at National Gallery of Australia

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: Canberra man Steven Howarth wiped tears from his eyes as, after less than a day of deliberations, a jury found him not guilty of raping a woman he met at a New Year's Eve party in 2023.

title.children: Canberra man acquitted of raping woman at New Year's Eve party in 2023

image.altText: snow covered fields in new south wales oberon

props.synopsis: Polar air from Antarctica is surging towards south-east Australia, bringing gusty winds, showers and low-level snow. While midwinter cold outbreaks are typical, the subsequent weather is nothing short of bizarre.

title.children: Strongest cold front of 2024 to bring weekend snow, followed by potential record-breaking 'blocking high'

image.altText: police tape in front of two houses

props.synopsis: The New South Wales Police Force will investigate its response time and emergency service dispatchers after a woman died at a property in Casino this morning.

title.children: Man arrested, critical incident declared, after woman's body found in northern NSW

image.altText: A group of Fremantle Dockers AFL players come together and embrace in celebration after a win.

props.synopsis: Ladder leaders Sydney lose a last-second thriller against the Dockers, while the Bulldogs take care of North Melbourne before the Suns host Collingwood. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Dockers stun the Swans in Sydney, Bulldogs back in the eight

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Watch the thrilling final moments of Freo's win over Sydney
FT: Fremantle holds on for an incredible one-point win over Sydney
No score! McDonald shanks it to the pocket! Freo win by a point!

image.altText: Warriors players celebrate

props.synopsis: After being thumped by the Titans on the Gold Coast last week, the Mount Smart faithful will demand a response from their against the Broncos. Follow live.

title.children: Broncos coming back after weathering fast Warriors start at Mount Smart

image.altText: Daniel Duggan

props.synopsis: Facing up to 65 years in prison, Australian "top gun" pilot, Daniel Duggan, says he's an innocent man in a high-stakes game between the US and China. So, is he?

title.children: How Daniel Duggan went from 'top gun' pilot to 'high-risk inmate'

image.altText: Ben Roberts-Smith in a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is distancing himself from a decision to award a medal from King Charles to former special forces soldier Ben Roberts-Smith.

title.children: Anthony Albanese says awarding Ben Roberts-Smith with a King's medal 'certainly wasn't a government decision'

image.altText: Joe Biden stands at a podium at the CNN presidential debate

props.synopsis: It was supposed to ease concerns about his mental and physical fitness, but instead Joe Biden's debate performance only enhanced them. Now, the pressure on the president to pull out of the election race is intensifying.

title.children: Joe Biden has stated the obvious after his panic-inducing debate. But can he recover?

image.altText: Joe and Jill Biden wave as they enter a stage draped with US flags.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden has attempted to reassure supporters after his damaging debate performance, conceding he doesn't speak as well as he used to, but insisting he can still competently serve.

title.children: 'I'm not a young man': Biden vows to 'get back up' after damaging debate

image.altText: Stylised sepia picture of a man in black clothing and a balaclava holding fire arm, crime scene tape and police in background

props.synopsis: Two days after being sentenced, the man dubbed the "bicycle bandit" died. Kym Allen Parsons robbed 10 banks and attempted to rob an 11th. Who was he and how did he remain on the run for so long?

title.children: This ex-cop was on the run for two decades after 11 heists. He was finally sentenced this week — now, he's dead

image.altText: A small security camera being installed on a yellow wall

props.synopsis: Many Australians can now access surveillance tech, but this can lead to disputes between neighbours. Here's a breakdown of some of the legal issues that can crop up.

title.children: Do your neighbour's security cameras make you uncomfortable? Here's what you can do

image.altText: an outdoor barbecue that was taken inside a house and used as a heating implement

props.synopsis: Three people were left unconscious at the Wentworthville residence, with fire crews saying the carbon monoxide levels inside the home were more than four times the dangerous limit.

title.children: Sydney family lucky to be alive after inhaling carbon monoxide from outdoor BBQ used to heat home

image.altText: Anthony Albanese looks sternly off to the distance.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has criticised tech behemoth Meta for claiming social media hasn't harmed kids, and for threatening to block news content.

title.children: Prime Minister slams 'arrogant' tech giant Meta over harm to kids and media

image.altText: A wide mountainous area with an inset of a smiling young man

props.synopsis: Amid glaring neon signs, cheap alcohol and booming music, friends of missing 19-year-old Jay Slater saw him for the last time before he vanished.

title.children: A missing teen told a friend he was 'lost in the mountains' of a remote Spanish island. Then his phone went dead

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Julian Assange's faces in a composite image.

props.synopsis: Some frame Julian Assange as a free press warrior and others a reckless hacker. As Anthony Albanese backed quiet diplomacy to free him, this unusual move to wield political influence over the legal systems of our democratic allies seems to have been lost in the haze.

title.children: Everyone smells blood in the water around the government. Framing the issues has become more important than ever

image.altText: An Australia post parcel from a compounding pharmacy on a table.

props.synopsis: The end of the financial year is a great time for shoppers looking to bag a bargain. But scammers also tend to take advantage of the period. Here's what to look out for.

title.children: Planning to shop the end of financial year sales? Watch out for this scam

image.altText: Woman standing staring at camera, with large artwork on wall behind her.

props.synopsis: Frontline services for domestic violence victims say women in rural areas often fear "if they return home they will be killed"  but there is nowhere safe for them to go. They say more funding is vital to save women's lives.

title.children: The 'most handsome man' she'd ever met broke Jacinda's bones. She says rural women need more help to flee

image.altText: A woman in a black and white top holds a microphone with her arms out.

props.synopsis: Glastonbury is the biggest festival in the UK, attracting the equivalent of more than two MCG's worth of people. Here's what's made headlines so far.

title.children: For the first time in its history, the UK's biggest music festival has two female headliners

image.altText: An elderly white man wearing a suit and red tie walks next to several microphones

props.synopsis: The billionaire investor and philanthropist's donations to the world's largest private charity, begun by the Microsoft founder and his former wife, will end with his death.

title.children: Warren Buffett to end donations to Gates Foundation after $5.3b gift

image.altText: A composite image of two women, one holding her face in her hands, and another wearing a crown of flowers.

props.synopsis: An alleged murder involving two well-known writers and former friends has shocked the Pacific island nation of Samoa. Police are still piecing together what happened.

title.children: 'I was possessed by the devil': Two close friends, an alleged murder and a nation 'reeling in disbelief'

image.altText: A half empty beer glass sits on a wooden table top beneath lights

props.synopsis: The craft beer scene's biggest festival of the year became an inadvertent staging point for the many intersecting issues facing the industry. Brewers tried to put on a brave face but admitted "vibes were down."

title.children: Craft beer is going through a 'hell of a moment', but will brewers be able to hold on?

image.altText: Greg Lynn in a black suit and blue shirt wearing handcuffs as he's escorted out of court and into a van.

props.synopsis: Even for legal minds, Greg Lynn's murder trial over the deaths of two Victorian campers was filled with "unusual" twists and turns. Here's what could come next in the long-running court case.

title.children: Here's what will happen if Greg Lynn appeals his conviction over the murder of camper Carol Clay

image.altText: A younger man stands with an older man and an older woman inside a house, smiling

props.synopsis: A new report released by the NSW government on the first three months of voluntary assisted dying provides data on how many people have taken up the service, with supporters welcoming the results.

title.children: Geraldine was one of the first in NSW to receive voluntary assisted dying. Her son said her death was dignified

image.altText: Tom Trbojevic limps off the field and holds his head

props.synopsis: Manly star Tom Trbojevic will move from fullback when he returns from injury next week as the Sea Eagles look to end the former Dally M winner's shocking run with injury.

title.children: Manly confirm shock switch for Tom Trbojevic as club looks to end injury woes

image.altText: A man stands on stage pointing to a crowd while holding a microphone, a luxury car behind him

props.synopsis: MrBeast is YouTube's most subscribed to content creator, with a staggering 290 million followers. So why are his videos so enjoyable for his legions of fans?

title.children: Handing out luxury cars and wads of cash like confetti, MrBeast draws massive crowds who love watching others win

image.altText: A portrait of Princess Anne looking off to her right with a small smile.

props.synopsis: Princess Anne has been discharged from hospital after suffering a concussion, believed to be caused by a horse. Here's what to know about 'the hardest-working royal'.

title.children: Princess Anne is out of hospital after suffering horse-related head injury. It wasn't her first

image.altText: A man with glasses in a bowtie

props.synopsis: Martin Mull appeared in beloved roles such as private eye Gene Parmesan on Arrested Development and would be nominated for an Emmy in 2016 for a guest turn on Veep as Bob Bradley.

title.children: Actor Martin Mull, known for guest spots on Roseanne and Arrested Development, dies aged 80

image.altText: Young Female Welder Working In Factory Wearing Protective Safety Gear.

props.synopsis: There's more bill pain underway for households, but it's businesses that will bear the brunt of the latest gas crisis rippling through Australia's south-eastern states in the dead of winter.

title.children: Businesses 'on stand-by to switch off' in fallout from gas crisis gripping Australia's east

image.altText: A bald man sitting at a ABC branded microphone with an on air sign lit up in the background.

props.synopsis: CSIRO CEO Dr Doug Hilton is urging politicians not to undermine scientists in the energy debate, after finding himself in the political firing line.

title.children: CSIRO chief executive says Peter Dutton's comments on energy report 'corrode public trust in science'

image.altText: A family of 14 walk hand-in-hand while wearing matching red shirts.

props.synopsis: Caroline Langguth feared she may never be able to have children after being diagnosed with type 1 diabetes as a teen.

title.children: Caroline is about to deliver her 14th baby — and her midwife has been there every step of the way
